result.execSummary:
The defendant Lorne Andrew Young #00646241 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Negligent Handling of Dangerous Weapon/Explosive, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.08(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Costs $268.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt:
09:45 AM  Defendant Lorne Andrew Young in court appearing by phone from custody in John C Burke Correctional.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Hearing on DE's petition for sentence adjustment. The State has objected.  Mr Young makes statement.  He states his release date is 11-21-2020.    9:47 Atty Poquette makes statement of objection.  Mr Young makes further statement.
The State has complied with Victim's rights.
9:50 am  Court makes statement.   Court denies Defendant's Petition, does not feel it is in the best interest of the public.
Sentence adjustment review on September 25, 2019 at 09:45 am.

Motion Hearing 1/11/18
from court of appeals:  It is ordered that the time for deciding postconviction motion is extended to 2/2/18

Defendant Lorne Andrew Young in court with attorney Jefren Olsen.  Defendant Lorne Andrew Young in custody appearing by video from Fox Correctional.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Olsen filed Motion for post-conviction relief: addresses two issues- new factor and court basing discretion on improper sentencing factor- Atty Olsen presents motion. 1:40 pm, Fox Lake Correctional needed video room for next hearing, DE and Atty Olsen were notified prior to beginning of hearing of this possibility, and neither object.  Atty Olsen states it is a non-evidentiary hearing so he does not take issue.  Lorne Young is disconnected by video.
Atty Poquette makes brief statement in reply.  Atty Olsen continues.  Court discussion with Atty Olsen.  Input by the State.  
Court needs more time to review both the State's reply and the Transcript; Will make written decision.
Court acknowleges that Atty Olsen will file another motion for extension of time for circuit court to decide post-conviction motion, as last extension expires 1-19-18.
State's Response to Defendant's motion for post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lorne Andrew Young in court with attorney Elizabeth Jean Smith.  Defendant Lorne Andrew Young in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 8:16 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  State has no changes to the PSI.  Atty Smith makes stmt as to PSI typo on page 15.  
State requests: 10 years - 5 years in and 5 years ES - no contact with victims family - restitution $3602.00 to Ms. Ross - $2650.91 victim compensation board restitution - credit 260 days time served - any counseling - costs $518.00.  E. Ross addressed the Court.  Ms. Beaulieu addressed the Court.  C. Ross addressed the Court.  Beth Stone victim witness coordinator reads stmt of S. Ross.  Atty Smith addressed the Court defense agreed to stand mute as to incarceration at the plea hearing.  


COURT:  Sentenced to 10 years prison - 5 years incarcerated credit for 266 days time served and 5 years extended supervision - costs $518.00 - any counseling DOC may impose - no contact with the victim's family, residences or places of work - restitution of $3602.00 to Ms. Erica Ross - $2650.91 restitution to the victim compensation board - DNA sample and surcharge -to undergo cognitive behavioral therapy - need to write a letter of apology to the family and needs to be approved by DOC agent before sent out and sent thru the department they will have discretion to determine if it should be mailed out - prison wages to be garnished to repay restitution/fines/costs - defendant is not eligible for Challenge or substance abuse
